stem: A demineralizer is being used in a water purification system. How will the accumulation of suspended solids in the demineralizer affect the performance of the demineralizer?

choices.A: The rate of resin depletion will increase.
choices.B: The flow rate of water through the demineralizer will increase.
choices.C: The differential pressure across the demineralizer will decrease.
choices.D: The rate of unwanted ion removal from the system will decrease.

stem: A sudden increase in the conductivity of water at the outlet of a demineralizer may result from... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: reduced demineralizer inlet conductivity. -545- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following conditions can lead to channeling in an operating demineralizer?

choices.A: Suspended solids forming a mat on the surface layer of the resin bed.
choices.B: A sudden 10°F decrease in the temperature of the influent to the demineralizer.
choices.C: Exhaustion of the resin bed due to high conductivity of the demineralizer influent.
choices.D: Operation of the demineralizer with influent flow rate at 10 percent below design flow rate.

stem: High differential pressure in a demineralizer could be caused by all of the following except... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: resin overheating. -546- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following is an indication of resin exhaustion in a demineralizer?

choices.A: An increase in suspended solids in the effluent.
choices.B: A decrease in the flow rate through the demineralizer.
choices.C: An increase in the conductivity of the effluent.
choices.D: An increase in the differential pressure across the demineralizer.

stem: The decontamination factor for ionic impurities of a demineralizer can be expressed as... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.C: Inlet Conductivity divided by Outlet Conductivity.
choices.D: Outlet Conductivity divided by Inlet Conductivity. -547- PWR Test Items

stem: The ion exchange efficiency of a condensate demineralizer is determined by performing a calculation using the...

choices.C: change in pH at the outlet of the demineralizer over a period of time.
choices.D: change in conductivity at the outlet of the demineralizer over a period of time.

stem: Which one of the following is an indication that a demineralizer resin has become exhausted? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Decreased demineralizer process water flow rate.
choices.D: Decreased demineralizer decontamination factor. -548- PWR Test Items

stem: The ion exchange efficiency of a condensate demineralizer can be calculated using the values for demineralizer inlet and outlet...

choices.D: pressure.

stem: To determine the decontamination factor for ionic impurities of a demineralizer, the two parameters that must be monitored are inlet and outlet... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: pressure. -549- PWR Test Items

stem: What percentage of impurities is being removed from the water passing through an ion exchanger if the ion exchanger has a decontamination factor of 25?

choices.D: 75 percent

stem: What percentage of ionic impurities is being removed from the water passing through an ion exchanger if the ion exchanger has a decontamination factor of 50? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: 50 percent -550- PWR Test Items

stem: The decontamination factor of a condensate demineralizer has just been determined to be 50, based on conductivity measurements. If condensate having a conductivity of 20 μmho/cm is flowing into this demineralizer, which one of the following is the conductivity of the condensate at the outlet of the demineralizer?

choices.D: 10.0 μmho/cm

stem: The decontamination factor of a condensate demineralizer has just been determined to be 10, based on conductivity measurements. If condensate having a conductivity of 20 μmho/cm is flowing into this demineralizer, which one of the following is the conductivity of the condensate at the outlet of the demineralizer? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: 10.0 μmho/cm -551- PWR Test Items

stem: The decontamination factor of a demineralizer has just been determined to be 5.0, based on conductivity measurements. If fluid having a conductivity of 20 μmho/cm is flowing into this demineralizer, which one of the following is the conductivity of the fluid at the outlet of the demineralizer?

choices.D: 100.0 μmho/cm

stem: What percentage of ionic impurities is being removed from the water passing through an ion exchanger if the ion exchanger has a decontamination factor of 1.0? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: 0 percent -552- PWR Test Items

stem: Two indications of channeling through an operating demineralizer are a __________-than-normal demineralizer differential pressure and a __________-than-normal decontamination factor for ionic impurities.

choices.D: lower; higher

stem: Mixed-bed demineralizer 1A was removed from service after it became saturated with sodium (Na+) ions while processing condensate with 10 times the normal sodium concentration. Alternate mixed- bed demineralizer 1B has restored the condensate sodium concentration to normal. Demineralizer 1A has not been processed in any way since being removed from service. If demineralizer 1A is returned to service to replace demineralizer 1B, the downstream condensate system sodium concentration will... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: remain the same, because demineralizer 1A can no longer remove any anions from the condensate.
choices.B: remain the same, because demineralizer 1A can no longer remove any cations from the condensate.
choices.C: increase, only due to the water volume contained in demineralizer 1A mixing with the condensate influent.
choices.D: increase, due to both the water volume contained in demineralizer 1A mixing with the condensate influent and the release of sodium ions from the resin. -553- PWR Test Items

stem: If water containing negatively charged ionic impurities passes through a mixed-bed ion exchanger, the negatively charged ionic impurities will be removed by the __________ exchange resin, with the corresponding release of __________ ions into the water.

choices.D: cation; positive

stem: How does demineralizer differential pressure indicate the condition of a demineralizer resin bed? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Low differential pressure indicates flow blockage in the demineralizer.
choices.B: Low differential pressure indicates that the demineralizer resin bed is exhausted.
choices.C: High differential pressure indicates flow blockage in the demineralizer.
choices.D: High differential pressure indicates that the demineralizer resin bed is exhausted. -554- PWR Test Items

stem: A lower-than-expected differential pressure across a mixed-bed demineralizer is an indication of...

choices.D: a decrease in inlet conductivity.

stem: As the operating time of a demineralizer resin bed increases, the differential pressure across the bed... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: increases due to depletion of the resin ion exchange sites.
choices.B: increases due to trapping of suspended solids.
choices.C: decreases due to gradual resin breakdown.
choices.D: decreases due to erosion of the resin ion exchange sites. -555- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following will cause a large pressure drop across a demineralizer that is in operation?

choices.A: Channeling of flow through the demineralizer.
choices.B: Decrease in flow rate through the demineralizer.
choices.C: Accumulation of suspended solids filtered by the resin beads.
choices.D: Improper demineralizer venting after resin fill.

stem: An indication that a demineralizer resin bed is clogged is a... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: large pressure drop across the bed.
choices.B: high flow rate through the bed.
choices.D: large conductivity increase across the bed. -556- PWR Test Items

stem: A higher-than-expected differential pressure across an operating demineralizer can be caused by... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: exhaustion of the cation exchange resin.
choices.D: decreased demineralizer inlet conductivity. -557- PWR Test Items

stem: A fluid demineralizer differential pressure (D/P) gauge indicates 6.0 psid at 50% flow rate. Which one of the following combinations of flow rate and demineralizer D/P observed at various power levels over the next few days indicates an increase in the accumulation of insoluble corrosion products in the demineralizer? Fluid Demineralizer Flow Rate D/P (psid)

A fresh demineralizer that continuously processes water with a high concentration of suspended solids will first develop an increase in the... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: pH at the demineralizer outlet. -558- PWR Test Items

stem: A fluid demineralizer differential pressure (D/P) gauge indicates 4.0 psid at 50% flow rate. Which one of the following combinations of flow and demineralizer D/P observed at various power levels over the next few days indicates an increase in the accumulation of insoluble corrosion products in the demineralizer? Fluid Demineralizer Flow Rate D/P (psid) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: 100% 15.6 -559- PWR Test Items

stem: A fluid demineralizer differential pressure (D/P) gauge indicates 4.0 psid at 50% flow rate. Over the next two days plant power changes have caused fluid flow rate to vary between 25% and 100%. Which one of the following combinations of flow and demineralizer D/P, observed during the power changes, indicates an increase in the accumulation of insoluble corrosion products in the demineralizer? Fluid Demineralizer Flow Rate D/P (psid) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: 25% 1.0 -560- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following describes a possible cause and effect associated with a lower-than- normal differential pressure across a demineralizer during otherwise normal system flow conditions?

choices.A: The resin has developed low resistance flow paths, which can decrease the decontamination factor for the demineralizer.
choices.B: The resin has developed low resistance flow paths, which can increase the decontamination factor for the demineralizer.
choices.C: The resin has become compacted, which can reduce the flow rate through the demineralizer and decrease the decontamination factor for the demineralizer.
choices.D: The resin has become compacted, which can reduce the flow rate through the demineralizer and increase the decontamination factor for the demineralizer.

stem: Which one of the following, if processed through a demineralizer, will rapidly reduce the effectiveness of the demineralizer? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Radioactive water -561- PWR Test Items

stem: What is the reason for bypassing a demineralizer due to high temperature? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Resins expand and restrict flow through the demineralizer.
choices.B: Resins decompose and restrict flow through the demineralizer.
choices.C: Resins decompose and create preferential flowpaths through the demineralizer.
choices.D: Resins decompose and release resin particles into the flow. -562- PWR Test Items

stem: When a mixed-bed demineralizer resin is exhausted, the resin should be replaced or regenerated because...

choices.A: ions previously removed by the resin will be released into solution.
choices.B: the resin will fracture and particles may escape through the retention screens.
choices.C: particles previously filtered out of solution will be released.
choices.D: the resin will physically bond together, thereby causing flow blockage.

stem: A demineralizer that has been exposed to excessively __________ should be bypassed because the resin beads may release previously removed ions. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: low temperature -563- PWR Test Items

stem: A result of proper demineralizer operation on water with ionic impurities is that the exiting water will always have a...

choices.D: lower conductivity.

stem: Demineralizer 1A was removed from service after it became saturated with chloride ions while processing fluid with 10 times the normal chloride concentration. Replacement demineralizer 1B has restored the chloride concentration to normal. Demineralizer 1A has not been processed in any way since being removed from service. If demineralizer 1A is returned to service to replace demineralizer 1B, the downstream fluid system chloride concentration will... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: remain the same, because demineralizer 1A resin has already been conditioned by previous operation.
choices.B: remain the same, because demineralizer 1A resin can no longer remove chloride ions from the fluid.
choices.C: increase, only due to the volume of water contained in demineralizer 1A mixing with the incoming fluid.
choices.D: increase, due to both the volume of water contained in demineralizer 1A mixing with the incoming fluid and the release of chloride ions from the resin. -564- PWR Test Items

stem: A demineralizer should be removed from service if the demineralizer differential pressure is __________ than the established limit, or if the demineralizer decontamination factor is __________ than the established limit. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: greater; greater -565- PWR Test Items
